TopicTitle: Plane rolls to the right at high altitude

Articles.Content: So I just made a Sukhoi PAK-FA replica and I test flew it. It flew fine until about 8000-9000m altitude when it violently rolled to the right, and it was hard to control it until down to 5000-6000m altitude. I can't provide pictures for now, as I'm overseas. I will post a picture/gif when I'm back. For now I just want to know if anyone knows what's happening and how to fix it.

Due to the fact it's pulling to one side or the other it sounds like an asymmetrical flameout - one engine is starved of air.  You can test this by monitoring the airflow into the engines when getting to the problem altitude.
A craft file would be even more helpful here. I assume you mean that your gaming PC and you are separated by an ocean now? So when you get back.
